総括すると、随分とホラーになりました。過去ほど対戦ゲーという側面はなくなり、殺人鬼に追いかけ回されている感じが出ていて、ホラー映画を追体験している様なドキドキ感が味わえます。

他のレビューで見かける生存者側のマナーの悪さですが、ランク1では全く見かけませんでした。（そもそもそんな暇はありません）
少々イラつきますが、釣ったフックの前に陣取って絶対殺すマンをすれば、いいんじゃないでしょうか。それもまた殺人鬼だと思います。

I was really looking forward to this game, and I have to say: I'm disappointed.

I only have one other friend who really enjoys playing this game and is available at the same time as me --- we cannot play together because of the way Dead by Daylight works.

Basically, you can play with your friends in a custom game, which means you will have no random people or pugs (pick up players) in your party. So, if you only have 3 friends with the game. Its 1 Monster vs 2 Survivors. That's it. Unfortunately, with my time schedule, I usually have only 1 friend around. So... it's just a 1v1 which is not fun at all, it's easy to just get murdered with no chance of making it.

If we want to play with more people or a full group, we have to queue up into random pug groups, however, you cannot just click 'join game' to join your friend. It doesn't work. Therefore there is an excessively slim chance in getting to play with your friend since its completely random who you'll end up with. So this was a waste of my money, to be fully honest.

Game is kinda rough around the edges but its a great asymmetrical multiplayer game with fun mechanics and with a good sense of balance between the three killers and the four survivors. The unlock system is alright and not nearly as much of a grind as evolve IMO. Definitely needs some work particularly involving rage quitters, the party system and just general glitches. 20$ is the right price for this kinda game in my opinion but if it doesn't get fixed up I'd say wait until its on sale.

This game is reeeeeeally fun and I am still highly enjoying it. 
However, there are some things that could change.

"We did a pretty good job so far"

This is another game with great ideas but poor execution. It is yet another victim of releasing both too early and not thinking things through to their logical conclusion.

The game's gimmick is similar to the Friday the 13th game, but with more killers.

Not only is the game just as buggy as it was in its beta state, but systems like it's ranked matchmaking don't even take into account disconnects. A player who disconnects robs you of points so you'll often rank down through no fault of your own. It has a half-assed progression system that is nothing but pure grinding for items you lose once used that massively favors no life farmers over the average player. Fully leveled characters are twice as powerful as brand new ones. Doesn't seem like a big deal now but wait until the game's older. Especially considering that perks you get by leveling are random, some don't even work while others are godly.

For all intents and purposes, survivor is what you'll be playing. As you can imagine, Killer is the most fun to play but this means everyone wants to be killer. Giant queues. I spent 40 minutes waiting for my first killer match. The game throws survivors into lobbies created by killers. Because the devs are either idiots or cheapskates, the game is peer to peer with no dedicated servers, ensuring that Killers in Ireland teleport to American players and hit them with telekinesis. Watch in amazement as actions that take 1 second to complete normally take you 3 precious seconds. Not that much fun.

There are situations where Killers cannot kill teens because they jump through windows faster than they can. In certain buildings it means the teens are immortal because they dance from window to window. So if the last teen alive is in one of these rooms and refuses to leave... The game doesn't end. You are both stuck in purgatory until one of you dies of boredom. Like I said, the devs didn't think this one through.

Survivor can have very intense moments but it is also more painful and frustrating than anything else. You mostly depend on gimmicks like slow window vaulting from killers and planks you can stun killers with to survive. Caught without any of these and you are done. So Killer is both simultaneously overwhelming yet completely helpless in other circumstances. The game doesn't offer much depth, so matches often play out in a very similar fashion. There are no skill shots for killers or survivors to make, no real aiming to speak of, a few QTEs when reparing or healing, but beyond your strategy, tactics, and learned cheese maneouvers there's not much to learn. Play a few hours of the game and you'll see everything it's got to offer that isn't hidden behind hours of experience grinding, which is no doubt what the devs think will keep people around.

All this being said the game has good points. Before you learn all the one dimensional but very effective cheesy moves survivor can make to troll killers, it can be an intense experience. If you are the sort that hates to die alot survivor might suck, which is my case. But you do learn to dread the killer's approach if you are out in the open, never really knowing whether he sees you in those blades of grass.

Actually playing the Killer is where the game really shines. You most certainly feel powerful and predicting your prey's movements and cutting them off feels so good. You can play with your food as well to gain more and more points and it truly is difficult to feel like you completely lost. A good killer can farm noobs and kill 3 or 4 per match, but even really poor Killers can get their jollies knowing they just deranked whatever 1 or 2 bastards are unlucky enough to get caught. Games that look completely lost can turn around because some survivors are altruists and will try to save their friends, often ensuring they just die hopelessly too.

Despite the negatives I've listed the core game has potential. If the devs took some time to fix the game's flaws, countless perks, achievements and systems that flat out do not work, I’d gladly change my review. As it stands now, I’d be a good purchase at 10$ or less, but not worth its full price.

Таааакс, ну вот и пробил час гневного обзора от человека, который играет с самого релиза и наиграл 400+ часов.
Начнем с того, что негатив в сторону разработчиков, у меня был вызван раннее выданным баном (нет, я не читер!). Так вышло, что с моего аккаунта в далеком 2016 году был использован хак на бладпоинты (да, моя карма, за отданый «погонять» на время аккаунт), о чем я узнал уже только после непосредственного бана в 2018 году. Мои попытки достучаться до разработчиков, объяснив им ситуацию и доведя до их сведения, что я стримлю их продукт и делаю по нему контент, успехом не увенчались. В итоге я получил стандартную отбивку бех объяснения каких-либо конкретных причин, прождав месяц. Но даже после такого плевка, я сделал новый акк, купил опять игру + длс к ней и продолжил играть. К слову, на прогресс и ачивки мне было крайне похер (я был готов легко с этим расстаться). Важным аспектом решения вопроса для меня были — запуск игры с основного аккаунты и отсутствие «клейма» в виде чудесной надписи о VAC-блокировке. Чудесная поддержка и индивидуальный подход, браво!
Обновление с этими ссаными эмблемами, которые непонятно зачем и для кого добавили, окончательно добило меня и отбило все желание не то, что бы стримить, но и играть в эту игру в целом.
Катку за каткой, я играю с аутистами (серьёзно, это жесть! нет, ну бывало такое, но не каждую же катку), которые ложаться под мана штабелем, нихера не делают, а если и делают, то явно не то, что надо. Что случилось с игрой? Резко нормальные игроки перестали в нее играть? Судя по гайду описания системы эмблем, командная починка генеров приносит меньше очков, чем индивидуально заведенный генер, а значит перки Дуайта идут нахер и получается, хочешь апнуть ранг и поднять бп, иди заводи в одиночку, но когда како-нить аутиста вздернут, ты все бросай и беги его спасать. Вы чего, там, товарищи из Behavior, обкурились что ли? Нет, можно канеш забить хер на эмблемы и играть, как раньше, но тогда ты нихера не получишь. Раньше было необязательно даже выживать, ты мог тянуть катку, спасать сурвов, прикрывать их собой, помогая заводить им генеры, а в конце героически погибнуть в бою, что награждалось хорошими бп и как минимум одной каплей, сейчас этого нету, давайте пошлем все это в жопу и добавим обосанные эмблемы.
Прокачка идет крайне медленно, за манов играть вообще невозможно, ты ими тупо особо не заработаешь ничего (а потом неадекваты из рашн дбд коммуны будут выливать на тебя ушаты помоев, что ты мейнсурв). Я признаюсь, за манов то очень редко играю, ибо мне приятнее командная игра, а не одиночная, но иногда могу побегать и вот за хрюшку помню вполне неплохо мог тащить, сейчас, ужас, я будто резко разучился играть (чего быть не может, так как играю регулярно). Ты сможешь нормально играть, если только ты реально проженный ас, не вылезающий с первых рангов, в таком случае, эмблемы тебе не доставят неудобств, но у нас ведь играют и среднестатические игроки (одним из которых я и являюсь), а также новички, которые просто ахереют от такого положения дел и кинут игру почти сразу. Товарищи разрабы, и вы хотите искоренить читаков? Лол, поздравляю вас, с этими эмблемами их станет только больше. Никто не будет дрочится до изнеможения, что бы заработать ссаные копейки, что бы апнуть хотя бы половину лвл. Все нафармят себе по полной, прокачают и будут играть по фану. Такие даже уже открыто стримят игру на ютубе и не скрывают факта читерства, а потом покупают рекламу в официальном паблике и пиарятся там, а на стриме вас и ваше скатившееся гавно закатывают в асфальт. Нет, не надо фиксить эту херь, её надо просто убрать к херам и не ломать игру. Хотя, я для себя уже все решил...

Подводя итог, хочу сказать, что я дико обожал эту игру и отыграл в нее почти три года, но как я вижу, наплевательное отношение и «отпущенные вожжи» стремительно делают свое дело. Разрабам пох*й на игру и игроков. Ну в таком случае, мне пох*й на них и их сктившееся дерьмо.

Не портите себе нервы и настроение, дождитесь лучше Last Year: The Nightmare.

I bought this game because I watched Youtubers play it and the game looks like a lot of fun.  However, I haven't been able to play a single game, trying to join a lobby.  The lobby keeps kicking me as a survivor AND killer after joining for only 3 seconds.  I'd like to give a great review on the game but the servers, matchmaking, and lobby coding needs to be fixed.  UNPLAYABLE because it's bugged to heck.

If this isn't fixed I'm demanding a refund.

Edit:  After uninstalling, demanding a refund, and messing around for a year I rebought DbD when it was on sale.  Let it sit in my inventory for another few months before installing it and giving it a try again.  The matchmaking is much better than before although the wait time to be a killer is significantly longer than being a survivor.  

There are blatant differences in the killers you play with, but there are no blatant differences (late game) with the survivors you play as.  I wish there was more of a variety and difference between the characters like the killers are.  Can't say I'm a fan of the Nurse...the idea of giving a killer 2-3 gap closing blinks AND a lunge to attack is a bit absurd.  Even though her normal running speed is equivalent of the Survivor's speed I think it needs to be slower than a Survivor if the devs give her 2-3 blinks and a lunge.  That or take the lunge out.  

The servers should NOT be based on the Killer's internet.  There are plenty of matches where the Killer's connection isn't that great and it greatly hinders the Survivors (much more so than the Killer).  Additionally, at the end of a match I'd like to talk to teammates, but if the Killer leaves it shuts down and the server, which doesn't allow for post-game communication.  I'm unsure of how to fix this problem but I think it should be addressed.

Overall thoughts of the game: Positive.  I like the different combinations of perks even though at a higher rank only a few perks remain champion to the rest.  Graphics are decent.  Each match feels much different than the previous one.  Enough maps to rotate through to keep me on my toes and interested in the game (unlike LoL where it's literally the same dumb map each and every game).  The game can go from going incredibly well to incredibly horrible and vice versa regradless if you are the Survivor or Killer. Have roughly 50hrs of gameplay and I still feel the adrenaline rush each and every time I play Survivor.  You'll start off being plenty scared and have plenty of jumpscare moments.  After a while it begins to fade, but you'll still feel the rush whenever you're being chased by the Killer or the last one remaining trying to get the Exit Gate open.  Your heart begins to pound in your ears, you think you hear the Killer so you run away only to find out the Killer isn't there...then you start trying to open the gate again only to find out you really did hear the Killer...the only question that you ask yourself...Fight or Flight?
The game should not have been released in this state, what an absolute joke, my only regret is that I had enough faith in it to play it more than the 2 hour refund period.

Played as a psychotic chainsaw wielding hillbilly:

Victim 1: Blew up a generator as he tried to fix it to open the escape doors. Could hear for miles. Tracked him down and smashed his face in. Left to bleed on the floor.

Victim 2: Tried helping Victim 1. Caught his leg through a window that he tried vaulting over. Hung him on a meathook and sacrificed him to the Entity.

Victim 3: Found by chance. Tried to run away through the cornfield. Chased him down with a chainsaw. Bled out like Victim 1.

By this time, the survivor team had managed to fix 4 of the 5 generators they needed to escape. I found the last survivor desperately attempting to finish what his friends had started and I hit him once from behind with my hammer. Realizing that he was found, he decided to accept his fate and turned to face his demise with dignity.

I was touched by his willingness to be sacrificed to the dark Entity which fueled my existence. And so I decided to prolong his.

Unable to communicate with him, I instead turned to the generator and smacked it once with my hammer.

He understood. Immediately he set off to work to fix the final generator, blowing a couple fuses here and there undoubtedly due to fear and confusion. When he finished I walked with him to the nearest exit, where he pulled the switch and opened the doors. He turned to face me once more in acknowledgement and then he walked away into the mist.

Now as the killer, I have a personal ritual where I always let the last one go.

Review from when the game first launched:

After playing several hours in just a few days, I have determined that yes, I would recommend this game to others. It's fun playing both the survivor and the killer. If you get bored of one, you can always play the other, although this hasn't happened to me yet. I think the game is definitely worth the $20 it's going for at full price, but if you can get it on sale, that's even better.

TL;DR

Overall it's a good horror game. It still has bugs that are quite annoying, but not necessarily game breaking, no party system yet (edit: party system has been added in), no in game VOIP yet, but still worth it for the $20 they're asking.

Pros:
Game is "team-based" in the sense that you can save others from the hook after they've been captured, heal others, repair generators faster w/ more people. I say "team-based" because that doesn't necassrily mean everyone will try to help/save others. They may be lone wolves and only in it for themselves, which adds some variety to the game.

Killers are unique and interesting each in their own ways.

Maps are procedurally generated (and there are many, many more now since I first wrote this review.)

Skill-tree-like leveling system is procedurally generated based on the person/hero you play as. For example, one survivor, Claudette is a person who has mroe empathy towards others, so her perks/abilites are focused on healing others, whereas Meg is more self-centered and her perks are more for, but not limited to, playing solo and escaping by oneself/distracting the killer during a chase so the other survivors can work on generators, which are required to escape and "win" the game.

Cons:

No in-game VOIP (Update: There are now emotes. not the same, but they work. I don't expect the devs to add VOIP.)

Flawed survivor ranking system. If the killer rage quits or disconnects before the round is over, it's pretty much a guarentee all the survivors will derank. Devs say they're working on it and a new system will be in place "soon." 
(Update: I have not had this problem at all since picking up this game again. Not a single killer has disconnected, thought survivors sometimes do. But, killers (and possibly survivors, I'm not sure) are now awarded with a "quitter bonus" which makes deranking due to disconnects much easier on the people who stay and play the game properly.)

Some bugs are still in game that I have seen myself, like people getting stuck in objects, people unable to be grabbed by killer and can easily escape because of it, etc. 
(Update: Since playing this game again, I haven't witnessed any bugs, compared to when it first launched, there were a few I saw myself.)

Overall, good game and definitely worth $20 as of now. (Update: yes.)

[h1]Avant-propos:[/h1]
Cette critique a été éditée après 70 heures de jeu, dont la (très grande) majorité à sa sortie, et quelques heures par-ci par-là plus récemment. Elle ne s'attarde pas sur le meta ou le style de jeu préféré à haut niveau, ou même pour les rangs élevés, que je n'ai  ni bien apprécié ni même réellement atteint.


[h1]Description rapide du jeu:[/h1]
Le jeu vous propose de jouer un pauvre bougre enfermé avec trois autres malheureux sur la propriété d'un tueur sanguinaire. Votre but est de vous échapper en allumant cinq générateurs électriques un par un, jusqu'à ce que le courant reviennent aux portes par lesquelles vous pouvez fuir. Vous n'êtes pas armé, généralement mal équipé, vous ne pouvez pas vous défendre et en face de vous, un monstre de violence est prêt à vous poursuivre jusqu'à la fin des temps pour vous pendre à des crochets de boucher.
Le tout est jouable entre amis, entre amis contre un tueur inconnu, ou simplement en aléatoire, que ce soit du côté survivants que du côté assassins.

[h1]Mon avis:[/h1]

[u][b]Les bons points du jeu:[/b][/u]
+ Il y a une grande variété de tueurs, avec différentes apparences, des mécaniques originales, des façons de se déplacer ou se téléporter intéressantes.
+ Les multiples cartes ne sont pas répétitives, surtout dans leur environnement, même si quelques éléments de décors se retrouvent un peu partout recyclés.
+ L'ambiance visuelle et l'ambiance sonore sont réussies ; des décors sombres et inquiétants, aux herbes hautes balayées par une lumière glauque, tout en passant aux animations brutales, aux hectolitres de sang versés par les survivants, à leurs cris, aux grognements des divers tueurs et monstres, il y a de quoi s'immerger dans l'ambiance des vieux slashers.


[u][b]Les mauvais points du jeu:[/b][/u]
- Le grind pour des "perks" et améliorations du personnage, voire de plusieurs personnages si vous voulez avoir une composition de perks en synergie, est interminable, et cela me déplaît énormément.
- Mais de loin le plus gros problème qui empêche de jouer à ce jeu, c'est que si vous souhaitez jouer tueur, les files d'attente sont de quinze minutes au bas mot, et si vous souhaitez jouer survivant, ça va lag à mort en permanence et vous allez vous faire toucher à travers les murs, les fenêtres, subir des rollbacks partout, avoir du mal à passer les coins de murs ou barricades parce que l'action ne se lance pas ou que votre personnage spasme à travers les objets.... 

[h1]En bref:[/h1]
Si vous disposez d'une grande patience et que vous souhaitez jouer un tueur assoiffé de sang qui martyrise des victimes paniquées, vous pouvez jouer à ce jeu. Il vous faudra attendre longtemps dans votre lobby, mais si votre connexion est décente, vous n'aurez que le grind à supporter. Dans le cas où vous souhaitez jouer survivant, même avec des amis, oubliez, vous tomberez en boucle dans des parties où l'hôte (le tueur) est à l'autre bout du monde ; et cela sera, au mieux, un exercice en frustration.

Dead by Daylight is a fantastic game, however, it's extremely misunderstood. In the 2 days it's been released, all I've seen are people complaining that they can't play with friends, or that if they can get a full group for the "Kill Your Friends" mode, they can't progress.

However, it's easy to progress if you're with your friends and quite frankly takes the whole point away from the game. You can communicate easy, you can provide information that wouldn't easily be available to your friends, and you can generally gang up and win pretty quickly.

But the point is...?

It's All for One or One for All.

The point of playing with randomers is you can't trust anyone. There's no communication, there's no information that's given to you which you'd have no way of knowing unless the game itself told you.

You see someone is being hung up on a hook? Do you go save them? Or do you not? I have had some random people save me, a few times in one game, just for me to turn around and betray them. I'm an asshole, I know. But that's the thing.

I added the guy afterwards and we talk now and again about the game.

Playing with randomers is the best part of this game, because it gives you the choice, or it forces the choice upon you. With friends, you won't get that choice because you'll go and do it anyways, why wouldn't you? 3 players going to save 1 guy? Killer stands no chance.

---

To sum it up, if you want a game to play with thrills, suspense, action and intense gameplay, and you can survive without having to have your friends in public lobbies, then definitely get this game.

What's also cool about the tree is that you can't get all the items the higher level you go so you have to think a bit on what you really want and what you are okay with losing. Same with the killers. They don't share anything with each other and everything is random with the skill tree. What is nice is that you can use your bloodpoints (XP or Money) on anyone. So can get 10000 points on a survivor and then dump it all on a killer if you really want to.

Gameplay wise. It can be a little repetitive with there only being 12 maps but it's randomlly generated on where everything is gonna be placed  so that's what really keeps me playing. The best part of this game really comes when you start to tense up because you are so worried that you can die at any moment. There was a match I had where at the start of it the survivors left instantly because the server was lagging so I was all alone to turn on all five generators. For the next 37 mins I was in complete silence just focusing on staying alive and turning on the generators as the killer hunted me down placing his traps to get me and there were serveral moments where I almost died because I was a step away from a trap or he was close to finding me. By the end I had 1 generator left but then I saw the hatch to escape because I was the last one alive and my hope went through the roof as I recklessly ran towards it only to step on a trap next to it. Losing my mind at this point I was ready to give up out of anger but I managed to get out of the trap in one attempt.With the killer seconds away from me as I get out I ran to the hatch and then the lag kicked in again. The most stressful 10 seconds right there because the lag was awful as I was attemping to get into the hatch while the killer was swinging at me. And what do you know I escaped. I was so happy that all my effort wasn't wasted and at that point I realized this is what makes the game great, these stressful and tense moments is what makes it great. 

If you are looking for a good game to play look no further. I have only played this game solo but I had lot of fun with it so far and I can't wait to play it with my friends somepoint in the future.

Edit: Still a pretty good games and the updates are just making it better.

Prologue
For me the gameplay is alot of fun and its run smoothly at 50 to 60 fps (I have a GT 650m which is about the same if not a little worse than the minimum but I have had to turn it down to medium). If you are curious about my other specs please ask. 
Even though i have only played 6 hours it has been alot of fun on both sides as both sides feel completely different to play as. 
As the killer you feel powerful and almost unstoppable, a killing machine and that experience is rare and suprisingly enjoyable.
As the survivor you are powerless to fight back against the killer but you can evade and outsmart the killer and even without any voip in the game and even with complete strangers it is pretty easy to cooperate on actions such as generators but not on more advanced tactics.

Bugs and Online troubles
In terms of bugs I havent found anything major that is gamebraking but realize some people have.
Although I dont like that they dont have co-op with friends in ranked at launch the dev team plans to add it.
Lack of being able to rebind keys (another thing the dev team has taken into account and plans to add it).
Also there are problems with online with people leaving and hopping to other games and if the killer leaves.
Other problems include loss of rank which tends to happen alot to some people.



Opinion Section (personal opinion that is meant to be taken with a grain of salt, also please dont put me on a hook if you dont like my opinion)
The only thing I get annoyed by is when killer camps a person on hook, the reason I dont like this is because for the person trapped it is almost fustrating to know you are already dead and there isnt much you can do about it, although if you arent the one trapped it means free generator time.
Most people dont like the wraith, personally I find him to be annoying but easy to beat as most wraiths will predictably camp near anyone they capure in cloaked form.
I feel like the balance is fine except sometimes for placement of windows and how the survivors can bunny hop through them.

Conclusion
This game has many problems both small and big, we all know this at this point and I will not defend everything.
But I know with proper support a game like this can become a unique and amazing experience but it requires our support. I know how tempting it is to just refund the game and give up, But please keep and eye on it if you leave and if it improves then you can get it again if you want.
